Column Comment.0: SPATIAL PARCEL NATIONAL TOPOGRAPHIC SERIES: an ennumerated list of theparcels included in the NTS Survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.3: AREA TYPE ID: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.4: BLOCK: The block in the NTS system
Column Comment.5: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.6: DESCRIPTION: Describes areas which are only partially included in the land parcelsmallest unit described (such as quarter LSD for DLS survey system)
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: Date on which the land parcel became effective
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: LETTER QUADRANGLE: the letter quadrangle assigned to this parcel.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: PRIMARY QUADRANGLE: the primary quadrangle identified for this parcel.
Column Comment.12: QUARTER UNIT: Quarter unit letter, values between a - d. A unit is divided into 4quarter units.
Column Comment.13: REFERENCE PLAN NUM: Reference to a map prepared by a surveyor which showsthe land block in question
Column Comment.14: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.15: SIXTEENTH: Sixteenth number, values between 1: 16. Describes a grid areacontained within a rectilinear figure bounded by arcs of latitude and meridians oflongitude.
Column Comment.16: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.17: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes and bounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.NOTE: In this table, the FK is added to allow you to describe the polygonal outline fora parcel.
Column Comment.18: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.19: UNIT: Numeric values between 1 - 100. A block is divided into 100 units.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
